cause.description:
They receive no healthcare, live in shacks or caravans, and are poisoned by radiation from the Uranium mine (though it's existence is denied by the government). The living conditions could be described as "third-world," but do you know where this desolate place in located?
Pine Ridge Reservation, South Dakota, is home to the Oglala Sioux Tribe and is 2,000,000 acres large with an estimated population of close to 40,000.
That's right, Facebookers. South Dakota, United States of America: supposed home of the free and the brave. Where we focus more on Paris Hilton's jail time than the genocide in Darfur, where it takes FEMA five days to get water to a superdome, where human suffering is ignored and written off.
No more, I say. We can do something!
Check out these links for more information: http://lakota-aid.com/ http://friendsofpineridgereservation.org/ http://lakotavoices.com/ http://www.friendsofpineridgereservation.org/difference/Volunteer_on_the_Reservation.shtml
1. The living conditions of the Lakota people must be improved immediately.
cause.name: Forgotten People of Pine Ridge
